articles.title: UNICEF report highlights the impact of climate change on children's rights
articles.summary: A new report from UNICEF details the profound and escalating impact of climate change on children's fundamental rights to health, education, and protection...

articles.title: Global summit calls for stronger protection of digital rights for youth
articles.summary: Leaders and activists at the Global Digital Summit have issued a joint call to action for governments and tech companies to better protect children's rights online...

articles.title: New educational programs launched to empower children in underserved regions
articles.summary: Save the Children has announced the launch of several new educational initiatives aimed at providing quality learning resources to millions of children in conflict zones...

articles.title: Fact Sheet: The Right to Play
articles.summary: The UN has released a new fact sheet emphasizing the importance of the Right to Play as a critical component of every child's development, health, and well-being.

articles.title: Mental Health Support for Children in Crisis a Top Priority, says WHO
articles.summary: The World Health Organization is calling for increased funding and resources for mental health services for children living in areas affected by conflict and disaster.

articles.title: The Challenge of Ensuring Education for Refugee Children
articles.summary: The UN Refugee Agency has published its annual education report, highlighting the significant challenges and funding gaps in providing education for refugee children worldwide.
